alert.note: Alert for Kaufman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 28 at 11:03AM CDT until October 29 at 1:12PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following counties, Dallas, Ellis, Kaufman and Rockwall. * WHEN...Until 200 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is ongoing or imminent. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through urban drainage systems. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Flooding is ongoing in the warned area due to heavy rainfall that fell during the overnight and into this morning. Between 6 and 10 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dallas, Garland, Mesquite, Rowlett, Desoto, Cedar Hill, Duncanville, Rockwall, Lancaster, Balch Springs, Midlothian, Terrell, Seagoville, Forney, Glenn Heights, Red Oak, Hutchins, Royse City, Heath and Fate.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
